metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17666 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
rtl_p2p_noa_ie in drivers/net/wireless/realtek/rtlwifi/ps.c in the Linuxkernel through 5.3.6 lacks a certain upper-bound check, leading to a bufferoverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-168.197
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-168.197
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1062.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1098.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1063.68
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1049.52
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1125.134
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1129.137
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-168.197').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-69.78~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1062.69').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.109').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1054.56~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.68').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1049.52').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1029.32~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.134').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.137').
